nodes.title: I.1. Residential Structures Occupying Summits: Fortresses, breastworks, religious buildings, palaces, and related edifices
General site characteristics
nodes.body: The highly deteriorated primarily mud-block structures of KalingKa gling are situated on an inaccessible ridge-top, outside the agricultural village of ka ling. There are also a few stone foundations at the site. ka ling kharmkhar overlooks the west side of the DawaMda' ba valley, and is situated several kilometers down valley from the township headquarters. The compact group of ruins is approximately 30 m in length, and walls up to 2 m in height have endured. The period in which this stronghold was established is not at all clear. Local residents believe that the site has a Buddhist identity. At this juncture in the inquiry, antecedent settlement at KalingKa gling is a matter of speculation. The important agrarian DawaMda' ba valley must have supported archaic cultural installations but their location remains to be determined.

nodes.title: Oral tradition
nodes.body: According to local residents, KalingKa gling was a castle.

nodes.title: Notes
nodes.body: [34] I was unable to access the site due to the collapse of the upper reaches of the earthen formation upon which it sits.
